chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant David L. Sellers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David L. Sellers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David L. Sellers was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Submit and pay for DNA sample. Register with sex offender registry. Sex offender evaluation and follow through. Complete any treatment recommended by agent. Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David L. Sellers
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional #633299, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 11-18-2015)
Prior: 100 E. 6th Street, Ladysmith, WI 54848
of sentencing hearing held 8/14/15 at 10:00 am.

10:00 am - Defendant David L. Sellers appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed PSI report. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DE waives right to attorney. Comments and recommendation by DA. Exam of DE by Court. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Written explanation of determinate sentence provided to DE. DE is not eligible for CEP and is eligible for substance abuse. DE to surrender PSI report to clerk. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:22 am. 
Court imposes (Ct. 1):
20 year prison term consisting of 5 years initial confinement and 15 years extended supervision
Conditions:
Court costs
Submit and pay for DNA sample
Register with sex offender registry
Pay supervision fees
Sex offender evaluation and follow through
Complete any treatment recommended by agent

10:00 am - Defendant David L. Sellers appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Information has been filed. Parties have received and reviewed. DA states agreement. Court questions DE regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. DE reads and fills out preliminary hearing form. Court questions DE regarding right to attorney and right to preliminary hearing. DE waives right to attorney and preliminary hearing. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 1.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 2. Court orders PSI. Court advises of cont'd right to attorney and provides notice of right to attorney. Court directs DE to booking procedure. Adj. 10:20 am.

Defendant David L. Sellers appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE waives right to attorney.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Bond to continue.
Search warrant; application and affidavit; return of officer

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with any juvenile under age 18 except in a commercial or business setting.  Defendant must not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior consent of Court. Defendant must not possess any firearms.

District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr appears in person.  Defendant appears in person, in custody.  Possible charges stated.  Defendant's next court date is 04-14-15 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
